title: Ticket #7057: Improve the "process all files in a directory" use case
description:
It is surprisingly hard to process all the files in a single directory. For example, see https://agenda.hep.wisc.edu/event/1325/session/3/contribution/40/material/slides/0.pptx

This gets effectively impossible once one needs to start escaping the contents of the job Arguments and TransferInput; in TJ's example, it was ultimately impossible to do and these had to be re-parsed out of the ClassAd at runtime.

We should:

  1. Provide an alternate mechanism for providing a list of arguments. Could even be a JSON-formatted structure in the submit file.
  2. Provide a mechanism for providing a list of files to transfer where filenames can be any arbitrary, valid platform filename.

Both could most likely non-default or something optimized for integration with the Python bindings. The goal is that we get to the point where we can process arbitrary directories of files "without any tricks".
